newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak SAX backs off yr-high on lower averages.
newsitem.headline: Slovak SAX backs off yr-high on lower averages.

text.p: The Slovak SAX index backed off its 1997 high in listless trading on the Bratislava bourse on Thursday, closing down 0.94 points at 204.64.

Overall volume eased to 213,932 shares, from 235,110 shares traded on Wednesday, while turnover fell to 44.05 million crowns, from 122.83 million as investors took a breather from the bourse's recent rise.

VSZ gained five crowns to close at 725 and oil refiner Slovnaft gained 20 crowns to 1,020, but neither culd offset losses to pharmaceutical maker Biotika, which fell 29 crowns to 871, with its average price off 3.22 percent.
"VSZ has been wavering at its ceiling, close to historical highs, for a relatively long time," Radovan Dzugas of Creditanstalt said.

"A package of more than 100,000 shares in VSZ remains offered at a price some 30-40 crowns above the market, showing that someone has been strongly interested in not allowing the issue to fall," he said.
